Short: Highly prestigious scholarship awarded to students 18 years of age or younger who have created a significant piece of work within their given field. Acceptable fields include science, technology, engineering, mathematics, literature, music and philosophy, along with an outside the box category. Davidson Fellows must be available to attend, with one parent or guardian, the awards reception and other recognition events to be held in September in Washington, D.C. (Travel expenses and lodging will be provided by the Institute.)
Long: Highly prestigious scholarship awarded to students 18 years of age or younger who have created a significant piece of work within their given field. Acceptable fields include science, technology, engineering, mathematics, literature, music and philosophy, along with an outside the box category. Davidson Fellows must be available to attend, with one parent or guardian, the awards reception and other recognition events to be held in September in Washington, D.C. (Travel expenses and lodging will be provided by the Institute.)

Short: Highly selective scholarship awards a 4 year, full ride college scholarship to high school juniors with a track record of academic excellence, public policy interest, and service. The Coolidge may be used by recipients at any accredited American college or university. Anyone of any background, pursuing any academic discipline of study, may apply to this non-partisan, need-blind, program.
Long: Highly selective scholarship awards a 4 year, full ride college scholarship to high school juniors with a track record of academic excellence, public policy interest, and service. The Coolidge may be used by recipients at any accredited American college or university. Anyone of any background, pursuing any academic discipline of study, may apply to this non-partisan, need-blind, program.

Short: The Foot Locker Scholar Athletes program honors twenty student-athletes who demonstrate exceptional academic ability and strong leadership skills in sports, in their schools, and within their communities.  Nomination closes December 9th and the application closes December 30th.
Long: The Foot Locker Scholar Athletes program honors twenty student-athletes who demonstrate exceptional academic ability and strong leadership skills in sports, in their schools, and within their communities.  Nomination closes December 9th and the application closes December 30th.

Program name: Intel International Science and Engineering Fair
Short: Each year more than approximately 1,800 student finalists earn the right to attend the Intel ISEF as a result of winning an Intel ISEF-affiliated fair at a local, regional, or national level.  Intel ISEF finalists compete on average $4 million in awards and prizes and are judged on their creative ability and scientific thought, as well as the thoroughness, skill, and clarity shown in their projects. There are various scholarships listed on the website above, each differing in amount, eligibility, and application process. Students must first qualify at their local science fair, and the international competition will be held May 13th- May 18th in Pittsburg, PA. Fairs outside the U.S. may take place at other times of the year.
Long: Each year more than approximately 1,800 student finalists earn the right to attend the Intel ISEF as a result of winning an Intel ISEF-affiliated fair at a local, regional, or national level.  Intel ISEF finalists compete on average $4 million in awards and prizes and are judged on their creative ability and scientific thought, as well as the thoroughness, skill, and clarity shown in their projects. There are various scholarships listed on the website above, each differing in amount, eligibility, and application process. Students must first qualify at their local science fair, and the international competition will be held May 13th- May 18th in Pittsburg, PA. Fairs outside the U.S. may take place at other times of the year.

Short: The Regeneron Science Talent Search (Regeneron STS), a program of Society for Science & the Public (Society) is the nations most prestigious science research competition for high school seniors.
Long: The Regeneron Science Talent Search (Regeneron STS), a program of Society for Science & the Public (Society) is the nations most prestigious science research competition for high school seniors.

Short: The Siemens Foundation established the Siemens Competition in Math, Science & Technology in 1999.  The Competition is the nations premier science research competition for high school students and seeks to promote excellence by encouraging students to undertake individual or team research projects.
Long: The Siemens Foundation established the Siemens Competition in Math, Science & Technology in 1999.  The Competition is the nations premier science research competition for high school students and seeks to promote excellence by encouraging students to undertake individual or team research projects.
